name: gen
content:
gen noun [U]
(AGE GROUP)
Add to word list
Add to word list
informal short for
generation : used when saying what age group someone belongs to or whether they belong to the first, second, etc. age group of people in their family to have a particular nationality: I would say that a lot of the newer gen of gamers don't really have the patience for these products anymore. My mother is first gen Canadian. See also
Gen X
Gen Y
Gen Z
informal short for
generation : used when saying whether a product or device belongs to the first, second, etc. group of similar products or devices to be developed: Gen 2 night-vision goggles came out in the 1970s. This is similar to what was done with the first gen iPhone. The games were made for new gen consoles.
More examplesFewer examplesShe talked about her experience as a second gen British Sri Lankan.The new model uses the 624MHz version of the processor as opposed to the slower 520MHz chip in the second gen product.

gen noun [U]
(information)
UK old-fashioned informal information about a particular subject: give someone the gen on something So who's going to give me the gen on what's been happening while I've been away?
